title: Formula for Retarding Force due to the Viscosity
text: To calculate the retarding force due to the viscosity of the air layer, we can use the formula derived from the concept of viscous drag $$force:F=\frac{etaAv}{d}$$

title: Calculate the Force
text: As we know $$v=0.400$$ $$\frac{m}{s}$$, $$A=2.5\times{10}^{\left(-2\right)}$$ $$m^2$$, $$d=6\times{10}^{\left(-5\right)}$$ $$m$$, and the dynamic viscosity of air at 20º C η is approximately $$1.81\times{10}^{\left(-5\right)} Pa s$$, plug in the values to get F in $${10}^{\left(-3\right)}$$ N. (keep two decimal places)
